page.title: 11EDUCATION IN WELSHPOOL
page.content: Welshpool is served by 3 infant schools, a Junior school and a High School.{The Infant schools of {Oldford, Gungrog and Ardwyn}each have about 75 pupils aged from 4-7 years and 3-4 teachers. At the age of 7 years the pupils go to{Maesydre Junior {School.}This school also draws pupils from the villages of Leighton, Berriew and Trewern and at present has 246 pupils. At the age of 11 years the pupils from Maesydre together with those from other junior schools within a 10 mile radius attend{Welshpool High School,}a mixed 11-18 comprehensive of 1100 pupils and 78 teachers. The High School also hosts the{Adult Education {Centre}in the evenings with classes in Woodwork, computers, cookery etc. Local sporting clubs use the Gymnasium for training purposes eg.cricket.
